channel.title: CVE Feed for Advantech -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Advantech -- all products

item.title: CVE-2021-38431|2024-08-04T01:44:22.331Z -- advantech -- webaccess%20scada
item.description: An authenticated user using Advantech WebAccess SCADA in versions 9.0.3 and prior can use API functions to disclose project names and paths from other users.

item.title: CVE-2021-42703|2024-08-04T03:38:49.528Z -- advantech -- hmi%20designer
item.description: This vulnerability could allow an attacker to send malicious Javascript code resulting in hijacking of the userâ€™s cookie/session tokens, redirecting the user to a malicious webpage, and performing unintended browser action.

item.title: CVE-2021-38389|2024-08-04T01:37:16.503Z -- advantech -- webaccess
item.description: Advantech WebAccess versions 9.02 and prior are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, which may allow an attacker to remotely execute code.

item.title: CVE-2021-42706|2024-08-04T03:38:49.331Z -- advantech -- hmi%20designer
item.description: This vulnerability could allow an attacker to disclose information and execute arbitrary code on affected installations of WebAccess/MHI Designer

item.title: CVE-2024-2453|2024-07-08T19:52:58.826Z -- advantech -- webaccess%2Fscada
item.description: There is an SQL injection vulnerability in Advantech WebAccess/SCADA software that allows an authenticated attacker to remotely inject SQL code in the database. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to read or modify data on the remote database.

item.title: CVE-2024-2453|2024-03-21T22:39:38.185Z -- advantech -- webaccess%2Fscada
item.description: There is an SQL injection vulnerability in Advantech WebAccess/SCADA software that allows an authenticated attacker to remotely inject SQL code in the database. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to read or modify data on the remote database.

item.title: CVE-2024-2453|2024-08-01T19:11:53.526Z -- advantech -- webaccess%2Fscada
item.description: There is an SQL injection vulnerability in Advantech WebAccess/SCADA software that allows an authenticated attacker to remotely inject SQL code in the database. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to read or modify data on the remote database.
